column5: Want to extend my thanks to the people of Canada for all their efforts in maintaining the finest fishery in North America. I have been fishing in Canada for over 40 years and I have never had a bad experience with any of my hosts. Canada and its people are truly a gift and all of us fortunate enough to enjoy this treasure should give thanks.....Gratefully Yours,Eye Man

Well said, Eye Man...truth be told, if I could convince my wife that "It's not really a longer winter or much colder" I'd be moving Northbound in a hurry.Once again, my thanks to a superb people, culture and country.One question if I may...is Quebec REALLY part of Canada?? (just kiddin')
Willie.Just the hockey team is part of Canada lol.GO HABS!
Could not have said it better. We fisherman who venture into the blue Canadian waters are the luckiest bunch in the world. ...Catch and Release

We Canadians appreciate the sentiments.Thanks to the Americans for White Castle...when is Canada going to get one?Thanks to the Americans for the Anchor Bar in BuffaloThanks to the Americans for using up the .com's so we could start .ca'sThanks to the Americans for taking Brett HullThanks to the Americans for letting us keep Shania Twain....OK she moved to Switzerland, but at least YOUSE didn't take her.Thanks to America for making Buffalo a "Snow Drop Zone" so it misses Toronto.Stay off the pipe...and don't forget to wipe.Red
the people are nice , the fishing is great, have been in canada fishing at least 28 times "BUT" your goverment sucks just as much as our!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i will not be back
Just excuse our dingbat Prime Minister
Hey - don't discount our country because we have a PM who doesn't know how to fish!That, my friend, is his "issue"!
